36338465.review:
[i]Uhh, where can I find this kill of the week? Is it an actual thing or is it one of those "it was inside YOU all along" type situations?[/i] Zombie kill of the week - reborn is a platform shooter. There are a fair few elements at play with an upgrade and leveling system as well as in game currency to pay for your guns with. The game seems to be intended to be played online but sadly I (in Australia) was unable to find any active servers. The single player game is ok, a scarcity of ammo seeming to be my biggest downfall in my games.

[h1]Good[/h1]
-lots of content and you can't argue with a free soundtrack
-everything works well
-workshop support with a ton of user made content

[h1]Bad[/h1]
-clearly multiplayer would be great fun but might not work for everyone
-a bit rough around the edges
-no local multiplayer? Really feels like it should be included

ZKotW-R seems like a really nice little platorm shooter, boasting a lot of neat content as well as workshop support but the single player is a bit ho-hum. The game has a distinct style and lot's of replayability, so I can tentetivly reccomend this. [h1]3/5[/h1]

36313112.review:
This was a fun zombie game, and there's a lot tha you can unlock and customize: you can upgrade your charcters stats and guns, customize their appearance, collect parts to build things like turrents, use perks and a lot more. There's a lot of unlockables and customization to make up for the fact that there's only three game modes; Carnage is your typical survival mode, where you earn exp for kills, level up, and earn tokens to unlock new things for your character; Challenge mode is where you have to survive for x amount of miunutes on a level, and finally there's multiplayer, where you can play with other people; I think multiplayer is dead though.

There's trading cards if you like crafting badges, and the achievements are fairly easy to obtain too, but once you unlock all the achievements you'll probably get bored, as there's not much to do after that. All in all, I had a fun time playing Zombie Kill of the Week, and I'd recommend this game if you like zombie shooters and earning easy achievements; wait for it to go on sale before buying it though.

34580511.review:
一款横版僵尸射击游戏
1.Carnage模式：射杀在地图中不停刷新的僵尸
每波开始会出现一定数量的僵尸，需要躲避僵尸并击杀它们
随着波数的提升，难度越来越高（怪血多）
一定波数会有BOSS出现，击杀后会掉落特殊加成道具（各种子弹样子），拾取后界面左上角会有图标提示
效果包括了减速、点绕、一定概率爆炸、分裂攻击等等

2.游戏掉落分为4种
普通金钱（纸币或者小的金币的样子），可以购买武器、解锁门，每次挑战结束后不会继承到下一次游戏
ZKW-P（写着ZKW的硬币），一般出现在某些波数结束后的结算奖励中
特殊道具，可以暂时无敌、提升武器伤害、回血等等
升级道具，小几率掉落，可以制造物品（需要Handyman技能）

3.Challenge模式，生存最多4分钟
获取尽量多的分数
有个指南有些bug点，在这些位置上基本上不会有僵尸出现，可以快速完成4分钟生存的成就
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=555617988

4.初始就1个关卡，剩余关卡需要花费ZKW硬币解锁，每个10硬币

5.关卡里有时候会出现一个手机的样子
拾取后就可以在单机的时候选择增加BOTS机器人
非常有作用，类似于多人游戏
可以帮你杀怪，死了可以救起来

6.在选择关界面的左端，点击player按钮可以进行角色升级
包括：技能，天赋，高阶武器解锁，武器升级，制造、购买道具
每种武器都有自己的升级树，可以在伤害、命中、射速、上弹速度四种里选择升级最多5点属性，分别花费2/4/6/8/10ZKW硬币
升级完的武器可以选择reset重置点数，会返还所有的花费，不用怕升错
武器类型很多，全升级完大概要900+的硬币

7.虽然有steam云，但好像没用
需要在游戏options - profile里注册一个账号
才能同步账号信息

34415153.review:
What essentially makes [b][i]Zombie Kill of the Week – Reborn[/i][/b] different from other shooters is your goal isn’t to run through levels and finish the game, but to survive for as long as possible under increasingly dangerous conditions. Simple enough, but where [b][i]Zombie Kill of the Week – Reborn[/i][/b] really shines is in the added layers of depth and huge variety of features and customisation available.

Surviving longer gains you ZKW-Points which you can cash in to customize characters, customize weapons, buy new weapons, buy different perks, open new maps, and a lot lot more! Players also earn XP as they play, allowing them to level-up their character and develop them to fit their chosen gameplay skills. Survival is all about learning to use whatever you have.

[b][i]Zombie Kill of the Week – Reborn[/i][/b] is a brilliant 2D shooter and is a great addition to the zombie genre.

[h1]8/10[/h1]

DISASTER | BAD | MEDIOCRE | OKAY | GOOD | [b][u]GREAT[/u][/b] | AMAZING | MASTERPIECE

34227657.review: 当看到这游戏的第一眼我就被它吸引了，但他的价格让我犹豫，我认真考虑后认为它是一款爽快的游戏，但也许并不耐玩，所以他就呆在我的愿望单里直到前几天，打折以后我毫不犹豫买了份四人包送给几个朋友。入手之后，我发现我之前的话说错了，尽管单人模式确实容易令人生腻，但他支持创意工坊，并且自带地图编辑器，这很大程度上加强了单人模式的可玩性，但最值得一提的，还是他的多人模式，评测中最为人褒奖的也是多人模式，不再赘述，尽管延迟高，还经常的掉线，我依旧在多人模式中投入了大部分的时间，因为多人模式才是这款游戏的精髓和令人沉迷的地方，而这恰恰也是最为人诟病的地方，正如我前面提到的延迟、掉线问题，确实很影响游戏体验。另外，多人模式不支持创意工坊的地图，我不知道开发者是出于的某方面考虑还是什么，而我想说的是，请考虑让多人模式支持自制地图，如果是我考虑欠妥，也请不断更新官方地图来增加多人模式的地图数量。虽然游戏存在些许不足，但这意味着这款游戏还有很大的进步空间，如果我们将视线放在他的优点上，我们会在游戏中体会到极大的乐趣，而这正是我们玩游戏的初衷。我期待这款游戏变得更好，同时也将推荐给你们。

34193064.review:
It makes me feel simple that I enjoy this game so much. The gameplay; shoot all the things. Sometimes this is a really boring design choice, but here it works perfectly. Tension builds as you try to manage opening up new areas of the level vs buying weapons and amo, sometimes you really need that extra space to flee to as a wave overwhelms your position. 

I found I died a lot when my character was new, but levelling up brings the difficulty down significantly, and after a point, surviving becomes quite easy, especially if you are playing online or with a bot buddy or two. Without the hectic struggle for survival, and with a level fully opened up, there needs to be some end point. As far as I can tell, there is no end to the waves of zombies. Perhaps there is a huge grind involved to complete a level, but either way, it ultimately leads to a level ending with a quit, rather than from death. This is the game's biggest failing. There needs to be some sort of end-game.

É tão podre que chega a ser até divertido, mas não tem objetividade, aí abusa muito rapido.
Basicamente, é um game onde você simplesmente fica atirando nos waves de zumbies que vem chegando. Não curti.

Talvez se os desenvolvedores fizessem alguns objetivos para completar ou chefes para serem mortos durante o jogo ou até mesmo alguns níveis e missões para tornar a experiência repetida, porém mais divertida, este jogo poderia ser um bom jogo para se jogar com alguns amigos.

Ele é um jogo divertido durante 5~10 minutos, depois disso se torna um jogo muito chato, enfadonho e repetitivo demais. Toda novidade e diversão desaparecem muito rápido.

Você apenas mata zumbies para coletar grana, para comprar armas, para matar mais zumbies, para abrir portas e matar mais zumbies para coletar grana e comprar armas e abrir portas... e continua assim durante todo o game.

31426384.review:
If you're looking for a fun game to play then this is the game for you (if you have friends its even better).

The game has tons of character customization but mostly the character customization is just looking like characters from other games or movies even tv shows, you can look like Bill from L4D, Leatherface, Jacket from Hotline Miami and even ricky n morty.

The game has a easy learning curve so if you think that you need to learn some special tricks or anything to survive well...not really, but this game is somewhat punishing on players if you just keep killing the last zamboo  for the rounds do not have a starting delay, they just start instantly.

There is a level system and character upgrade system even weapons and unlockable weapons, however some of the unlockable weapons are meh compared to the other ones but sometimes they can preform just as well as the higher unlockable weapons.

Be warned, this game has...cheese...and by cheese I mean the voice acting, there is only one voice and it's this guy that sounds like he is having a bad day (Houston from payday?) Though it would be nicer if there was a way to edit the voice to something else as I looked in the files and couldn't find a single thing, so you're stuck with a dull boring guy.

The game isn't that hard, it's mainly COD zombies to some extent but it is original in some ways, though the cod aspect is mainly upgrading your weapon from a upgrade machine, using the fridge (Mystery fridge!) Which gives you a random weapon for 300$ rather than the cod amount of 900$ and it does the same thing as the cod zombies box, it teleports if you get the bear, but this one has limited used in the game.

If you're looking to play as a female character mainly because you find it more fun or whatever, sadly this game does not have that but you can look like a female anime character that looks like a maid, I believe it's from the touhou series?

All in all, game is good should buy, but there are a few reasons you should not.

There aren't that many melee weapons, only a katana which you cannot trade out at all, if you pick up the chainsaw you mainly screwed yourself over as it takes up a weapon slot and not the katana slot, there should be more melee weapons like a scythe or even just start players off with bad melee weapons yet you can upgrade your melee weapon or maybe get a random one from the fridge.

The VA is another reason why you shouldn't buy, it's a dumb reason but if you get easily annoyed by some dull voice then you should either mute your sound and play your own music so you don't hear the voice or just well, get used to it.

Too little character customization, you can only customize your head, torso and legs but the head and torso cost credits,  there aren't anyways to add gloves or completely look like a specific character like the touhou character, I'm sure she is ment to be wearing leggings of some sort but since well your character is male and there is very little customization, you can't get the exact look.

Too little weapons, well that's what it feels like to me, once you unlock those powerful weapons by spending credits you're pretty much set if you also get the perk or skill to have a random weapon at the start and by RNG you can get the D.O.M which is mainly the BFG that 1 shots everything except bosses unless upgrades, there should be a ton more weapons to mainly increase chance of not getting the super powerful weapons from the fridge as it makes the game easy.

Too little barricade options, I mainly dislike the barricade style, you simply place a box down and that's about it, you cannot stack them and there isn't that much variety so it gets rather stale with putting up defense, if there were more options like maybe a couch which breaks in segments when it's attacked or maybe like a bookshelf.

Jumppads feel too common, you buy them once for 100$ which allows zombies to use them but you then have to buy them with 10$ each time to use them, it'd be nicer if there were 2 routes, quick and easy route allowing you to take a jumppad or a long route which uses stairs

Unable to play custom maps in MP (From what I've noticed) I have no option to select custom maps to play but I'm sure I can, I haven't tried yet but I will attempt.

Anywho, those are some of the cons of the game, it is still a good game it just needs to be updated and worked on some more to grab the attention of people, as I feel that people bought this game, played it and then forgot about it and just uninstalled having it sit in their library.

31423222.review:
TL:DR - Buy for the multiplayer, otherwise buy it at a discount price for singleplayer. This game can get addicting once you are a few waves in and is better with other players.

+ Nice pixel work
+ Addictive
+ Multiplayer
+ Workshop
+ Character customisation


- No explanation of what power-up does what
- Lack of multiplayer rooms
- Music gets annoying after some time


I really like this game, it is addicting yet simple. Singplayer is ok, more fun when you find a bot or two to help you last longer. I figured out what some power-ups do, some are simple to understand but others may take some time to actually click with your mind on what they do.

You can make your character stronger with skill points and even upgrade the guns on their own making the one you prefer even better. Plenty of perks to go along side as well as your own workbench, which is a nice touch for a zombie game such as this.
I enjoy the cameos in the character outfits, such as Bill from L4D2, I just wish the workshop allowed us to make our own heads and torso's to make customisation a bit better but the outfits you can buy and unlock are great enough.


However multiplayer is where this game shines. If anything get the game for the multiplayer.

Multiplayer is where it can get hectic while also having its easy moments depending who is with you. You can use your skills or items you made into multiplayer and so far, I found no users who judge off level, the high levels don't mind level 1 players and so forth. There is a chat box so you can communicate though not sure if voice-chat would make it better, specially when you have more hordes and you will indeed get seperated.

My only issue with multplayer is

- If you join a game already in-play you are left at the start, if they are a few rounds in you may die very soon and they may be too far in the map to get around back to you, I can see this putting players off joining matches. It should really drop them off with the healthiest player IMO

- You get your own money to spend, this is an issue a bit later in maps when other players want someone else to open the doors because each player is saving up for upgrades or the mini-gun. If you have the most cash, they will expect you to fork-out even if you are close to what you was saving for. But I don't see this that often and a skill does help you get cash easier

- At the moment of this review, only 3 rooms were up and around 9 players for multiplayer. I hope more players actually play and get more rooms in multiplayer to make it more enjoyable for others

Otherwise, it is a total blast and is the best way to level up. Buy it and start slaying hordes along side friends, I already did 6 hours alone just today because how easy it was to get lost in multiplayer.

"Zombie Kill Of The Week Reborn" ist ein 2D Plattformer mit viel Potenzial. 
Das Grundprinzip ist Zombies Fraggen, aber das Spiel geht weit darüber hinaus. Man Kann diverse Perks, Waffen Gegenstände und vieles mehr freischalten. Dann kann man alle diese Dinge einzeln hochleveln. Man kann sein Aussehen verändern etc. etc.. 
Dazu braucht man "ZKW's", diese bekommt man durch, was sollte es auch sonst sein, Zombies Fraggen. 
Ein online Multiplayer sorgt dabei für die nötige Motivation bzw. für den nötigen Spass. Bis zu vier Spieler können im Koop Modus die Maps spielen. Das man sich gegenseitig wiederbeleben kann wenn jemand von den Untoten überwältigt wird sorgt für zusätzlichen Spass. 
Das Game hat auch den Steam Workshop integriert. Deswegen gibt es auch jede Menge Custom Maps usw. zum Spielen. 
Steam Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten sind ebenfalls integriert.
In der Kategorie 2D Plattformer steht dieses Spiel für mich ziemlich weit oben in der Rangliste. Es macht saumässig viel Spass und kostet nicht viel.
Ich kann es nur empfehlen, vor allem wenn man viel Spielpass für wenig Geld haben möchte. 
Top+++ Daumen hoch!!

De inicio comprei ele pelo preco que estava muito bom, nao esperava muito desse jogo serio mas um pouco depois eu vi que o jogo tinha um grande potencial e me viciou kkk sempre enquanto espero um amigo para jogar algum jogo ou quando acaba de jogar algo e quero dar uma zuada eu inicio ele, atualmente nao tenho muitas horas dele porque comprei recentemente mas em breve creio eu que vou alcancar umas 50 horas de jogo porque esse jogo e bem viciante, mas, recomendo que compre na promocao e compre duas copias porque jogar sosinho nao é muito legal ou facil, porem... ele tem um belo sistema de multplayer tipo se voce esta la jogando sosinho do nada aparece um pop up em cima na tela avisando que ha novas salas de multplayer e se voce iniciar uma sala (nao precisa abrir porta) vai aparecer para geral que estiver jogando no mundo inteiro. Agora vamos falar um pouco do jogo segundo minha experiencia atual


Prós =

- multplayers de até 4 jogadores
- Uma enorme variedade de armas
- 3 modos de jogo (pelo menos os que eu encontrei)
- Customizacao semi-total do personagem (modelos pre criados e hats/torsos)
- Mapas variados
- perks
- cosmeticos (dual beretas que voce compra e usa no jogo mas quando acabar o jogo ou morrer tem que comprar outro mas é bem barato, turrets, molotovs, barricadas etc)
- variedade de zumbis
- Mercado in-game
- amigavel para iniciantes (o jogo em si nao e tao dificil de aprender, apenas de sobreviver kkk)
- um sistema muito legal de bots (pra chamar um para seu jogo e necessario achar um nokia no mapa e pega-lo, quanto mais pegares mais bots terá)
- quase nenhum bug ou nenhum (nao achei um bug sequer no jogo)
- arte bacana
- Hat do Ricky (Ricky & Morty recomendo assistir na netflix muito foda +18)
- Uma enorme variedades de hats
- oficina de mapas (voce pode criar o seu mapa e jogar com amigos oque de certa forma ameniza um dos contras da minha analise logo abaixo)
- conquistas na steam
- cartas e insignias
- caracteristicas Hack N' Slash
- e muito mais


Cons =
- Poucos mapas, acho que totaliza uns 4
- poucas calcas (area de customizacao)
- falta de avisos (por exemplo ao dar upgrade em uma arma voce nao pode dar dnv porem o jogo nao avisa e voce vai la gasta 1.5k pra atualizar e nao muda nada mas come seu dinheiro :/)
- dificil de ganhar dinheiro para aprimorar itens
- falta de explicacao sobre como ganhar a moeda especial do jogo (bom pelo menos até agora nao vi)


Minha nota final baseada nos meus criterios (MEUS!) e minha experiencia (volto a dizer MINHA!) é de 9.5/10 e recomendo comprar para ser um jogo que voce vai jogar bastante junto com seus amigos e volto a dizer (COM SEUS AMIGOS! NAO CHEGUE PERTO DOS MEUS! NOJENTO :P XD :D)

Начнём с того, что в игре масса багов. Просто тьма тьмущая. На 50+ волне делать АБСОЛЮТНО НЕЧЕГО. Два-три дня игры, и вы тру-нагибатор нечисти. Схема проста, в каждую волну нам подбрасывают парочку зомби. ВСЁ. Оружие, ну, что сказать. Примерно так вот делали раньше игры на денди. Чем-то игра напоминает контр-страйк, пиксельный, убойный... Можно тупо стоять на месте, и... ВСЁ, я не понимаю, как вообще люди умудряются сливаться. Втащил сольником 53 волны... НАДОЕЛО. УСНУЛ. ПОЗВОЛИЛ СЕБЯ УБИТЬ. Ибо...понимаешь, что игра, не смотря на её олдскульность... ни о чём. Да, она представляет некий интерес, сама по себе, но, если её начать сравнивать... со старыми играми времён денди... 

Первое-Никакой сложности. Сперва да, много всякой ерунды, ничего не понятно. Но, стоит разобраться и... всё, стой как вкопанный, ни один зомбарь к тебе близко не подойдёт.

Второе-Сравнительно-приятное звуковое сопровождение.

Третье-Забавное графическое оформление.

Четвёртое-реиграбельна, только до тех пор, пока ты не вкачал хотя бы половину перков. Слишком уж они имбовые эти скилы и перки. Нет. Серьёзно. РПГ составляющая - на нуле.

Пятое-буду ли я в неё играть дальше? Скорее нет, чем да, несмотря на все свои достоинства и недостатки, игра займёт, максимум на пару-тройку дней, не более.

Адекватных тимейтов - кот наплакал. Ну видишь ты, что чувак стоит, и вокруг него ни одного зомбаря... ну куда ты пошёл? Стой рядом и будь паинькой! Нет, надо улепётывать на другой конец карты... да, эти "профи" ещё матеряться. На кого ты материшься? На собственную косорукость если только... 

Впрочем встречаются и адекватные игроки, но... за три дня, мне повстречалось их не так много.

Или они убегают от тебя, когда идёшь следом, либо сразу отключаются... , зачем вообще конектились.

Поднять, разумеется, мало когда додумаются, да, из-за лагов это проблематично.

А так, и да, и нет. Убить пару дней, вполне сойдёт, чего-то большего, ожидать, возможно, можно, если её будут в дальнейшем развивать. А, пока... тот же Лодаут, вроде, всё ок, но, чего-то не хватает.

Как же не хватает кнопки "Не знаю". Или чего-то среднего между "Да" и "Нет".

Так и быть, положительных сторон, всё же больше, поэтому "Да", за неимением других вариантов.

28600034.review:
Brilliant, amazing, fantastic, a real nice supplantation of the CoD Zombies formula into a side-scrolling shoot-em-up.

I figured one day I had enough money to pick up a super-cheap game on steam. That's just what I did - and fell in love near-immediately. ZKW Reborn is a pixel-graphic sidescroller shoot-em-up in the vein of such classics as Thing Thing Arena. Move on a 2D plane, your bullets fire towards your crosshair, you get nades and an assortment of buyable weapons. Maps are mazes of buyable doors and level setpieces, but they are only a small frame of the action - find a zombie spawn point and most of the time you can go to town, only returning to clear the round-end stragglers. One map is a bit crap, since going to a certain area before a certain round has a chance to lock you in and neccessitates a restart, but it's much less common than a now fixed glitch.

If slaughtering hordes of zombies on your own is too easy, you could always bring in a few bots to really put the smackdown on the fleshy tides - reaching the end of a series of buyable and round-locked doors in each map and claiming a phone pickup will grant you the ability to summon an AI-controlled companion to your cause, with each pickup giving you an additional virtual pugilist, up to a maximum of 3. While the AI for these companions is a bit lackluster and uncomplicated, if you need a gunhand and a medic at your side, these guys get the job done.

Other things that will help turn the tide in your favor include many more [i]CoD Zombies[/i] import mainstays - as before - buyable weapons that instead of being one set weapon, are selected from a category, a weapon upgrade machine, a random weapon box (a fridge, much more [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HilariousInHindsight] Hilarious in Hindsight[/url] after TranZit and The Farm), bonus drops and buyable doors. As you progress into higher levels and the waves get tankier, you'll need all you can to beat back the living undead.

Persistent progression appears in the form of a leveling system - prove yourself to be an enduring, enterprising renderer of flesh and you'll get points to spend on increasing the abilities of your zombie slayer and greater and more prestigious access to the tools of the zombie-slaying trade - and trade you shall, because you may be able to wield these weapons, but weapons and their mods don't come for free - ZKW points are the currency of the day, and they are earned per game by hitting round milestones, and when you level up, complete achievments, and fulfil the Objective of the Day.

With ZKW points you can buy new weapons to appear in the Mystery Fridge, purchase perks to change your strengths, equipment to be deployed in the heat of battle, and weapon modifications that can turn a lowly spray and pray into an efficient zombie lawnmower. 

The aesthetic of the game is simple yet satisfying. Think a fusion of pixel-art and Flash Low Quality settings and you'll be quite there. It will call to mind every memory you have of playing flash games on dodgy websites while dodging the web filters on the computers at school during your lunchbreak.

And the music is downright awesome - the 'Boss Loop' track is brilliantly cathartic - although you will want your volume control to hand, the game is fucking loud - which may or may not be a bad thing ;)

Perhaps the only downside is that higher waves seem to drag on - it becomes a loop of 'expend ammo, hit the boost cooler till you get max ammo, lather, rinse, repeat'. In that way it may be more fulfilling to set a max round for yourself, and submit yourself to your [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5wNoEP-WyKg]Moranian fate[/url] when you're done. Additionally the voice acting is a bit stilted and unenthusiastic. It's slightly charming in a B-Movie (B-, not Bee!) kind of way but it still sounds like the two blonde lasses from Drama class who seem to have more social blocks than a cathedral. The netcode is pretty uncomplicated too - Still Running make no effort to cover up the fact that you'll want a pretty damn stable connection to who you're playing with.

Nevertheless - at its cheap price it's easily reccomended. Good in nice small bursts.

26742590.review:
全成就后的例行评价：一个制作精良的小游戏，买的四人包，其中送了2个朋友想一起开黑，但是因为服务器的原因并没成功（貌似是因为我的主机当服务器是联通网，朋友是电信的网，进游戏后闪现、闪现、闪现...），联机中的问题：貌似不能直接通过Steam好友邀请，只能进游戏后从找服务器列表中找房间，不过并不影响，因为一般只能搜到一页服务器，一页最多显示五六个房间，每次都会找到朋友的那个房间（至少我是这样）。
    这个游戏不需要VPN，进入游戏后，如果你要玩联机模式，你需要注册账号（很简单，只需要昵称和密码）。然后就可以去其他人的房间里面去happy啦。本人玩的时候在青岛，搜到过黑山、冰岛的玩家房间、大多数都不卡，少数在闪现。
    游戏打起来挺爽的，嗯，真的，黄金加特林+爆头翻倍伤害（人物附加属性）+爆裂子弹（杀胖子会掉特种子弹，人物不死就不会消失）=堵在僵尸刷新点杀。到目前为止只打到了60多关，因为一点小小的连续失误给GG了。杀僵尸会掉落P币（可以在游戏外买人物装扮，解锁人物技能，购买游戏初始装备的货币etc...）和金币（游戏界面右上角，可以在每局游戏内买枪，开门，开冰箱，升级武器etc..）
    一点游戏的经验：1.如果只是为了刷成就，建议联机只在医院那个地图，虽然地形看起来不怎么样，但是公认的比较容易（不知道原因，可能因为每个地方只有一条路）的地图。
                              2.身上一共可以拿2把枪+1把砍刀，电锯占用热武器格子，成就内有烧死僵尸和电锯杀僵尸。除此之外，黄金M60（升级版）和黄金加特林（加特林升级版）是最后好用的武器没有之一。一把武器可以升级2次（=-=还是1次的忘记了），升级之后，如果你换掉了枪，那么下次你在那个地方买枪的地方就会买到一把最低级的枪，然后重新升级。
                              3.游戏前期被僵尸追着跑，中期缺钱买子弹，后期粘住鼠标堵门（你装备好的前提下）。
    游戏的不足（仅供参考，并不成为不推荐的理由）
    1.刷刷刷确实很无聊，后期真的是有点吐了，前期的shotgun，mp5什么的真的是无力，假如进游戏的时候，那个房间正咋打25关左右，我宁可直接憋加特林，然后攒钱在冰箱里抽M60.
    2.僵尸的类型比较少，到了后期，更厉害的僵尸只是比起之前的变了变色。不过粘鼠标阶段，也并不在乎他的样子，也许还没看清就轰成渣。
    PS：
    1.全成就指南在指南里有。还有不懂的可以问我。
    2.还有几个成就是在地图内坚持4分钟，在指南里面有几篇是专门写这些成就的，大概就是在每个地图都有一块区域是安全区域，在那个地方不会有僵尸过去。比如医院的三楼右边部分。这些4分钟成就要记住：1.不能堵门刚，一进游戏就是初期，前面也提到过了，前期被僵尸追着跑，根本刚不过。2.不是门开的越多越好，门开的越多，虽然你能跑的范围更多了，但开门是需要钱的，这样你就会损失一部分买枪的钱。同时，每开一个门就会出现一个新区域，那个新区域就会刷新僵尸。这几个成就我都是通过安全区的方法过的。
    最后，很推荐这款游戏，价格不贵，成就不难，BUG没遇到过，刷刷刷开始爽，之后无聊，祝大家游戏愉快。

[h1]Recommended at Discounted Price[/h1]
Good, Simple, and Casual Zombie Shooter with some Progressions/Customizations. 

I am quite surprised for what it as at the price. (can get it very cheap/often on huge discounted sale) The game is easy, and can be very easy once you get used to the gameplay.

There are a good amount of weapons, each with its own upgraded version. Imo, most weapons are different, performance-wise. There is only a few of them, that are damage-wise. There are some random power-ups, which can be very useful. Though, lucks play huge part on this, however, there is a passive skill to ease your pain on this.

There is the leveling system, with skill points to spend on some passives. There are perks. There are some funny character customizations. You can also customize weapons (spending coins on each of them to upgrade the stats).

Once you know what you are doing, the game will be very repetitive/boring though ...

You can make your own maps, play some workshop maps. There are some limitation though to keep things interesting.

You can get almost all archievements in 5-6 hours or less. I am missing 2, which are 10/15 hours of playtime.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
The game is good for what it is at the price.

24976174.review:
Fun, dumb, run and gun worth getting on sale, although full price isn't unreasonable either. 

Runs well in local and multiplayer, and most of the features are intuitive and polished. Makes playing solo or with friends relatively painless and is perfect for a quick 10 minute game to relieve some stress. On the flip side, you'll occasionally get together a team that just clicks and goes on an endless zombie killing spree.

The mechanics, sounds and graphics are all solid and create an atmosphere of satisfying, gory destruction. 

There are a good amount of weapons, though the balancing of availability, cash resources and enemy levels led me to focus more on mastering lower level gear. However a lot of people I played with stuck to heavy artillery, so maybe it's just a choice of play style.

The major downside is that the nature of the game is inherently repetitive. Campaign depth does not exist, but the variety of arenas and game modes is more than adequate for what it is.

EDIT: The developer (who I believe has an impressive track record of maintenance and updates) commented to remind me of the promised upcoming Campaign focused DLC. I forgot about it when originally reviewing, but if it matches the current quality level it should improve an already very good game.

The game is pretty simple. 
You start with a pistol and a katana. X amount of zombies will spawn and you kill them, get money, get a small chance for power ups. Spend money on random weapons in a fridge or to open doors. At lvl 20 you can use it to buy power ups aswell. Bosses will spawn, different enemies, more enemies etc etc. Lots of weapons to unluck with credits which you earn throughout the entire game.

These credits can be spend on: maps, weapons (which you can find in the fridge), crafted items and perks.
Currently there aren't many maps yet, but Mr Dev adds more and more over time.
There are alot of weapons ranging from a crossbow to a flamethrower and even a KILL EVERYTHING IN YOUR SCREEN WEAPON.

Each weapon can be upgraded in your current game to last longer. Bots can be unlucked by picking up phones I hope the developers will continue to update and add content to this great game!

22165702.review:
Купил игру по скидке, вооружившись своим любимым лозунгом "Почему бы и нет". Забавно, но когда-то я точно также покупал Hotline Miami, о чём ни разу не пожалел, как вы понимаете.
Тут точно такая же история. Потратил копейки - получил море удовольствия и убитых часов свободного времени.

Итак, это 2D платформер, суть которого - мочить зомби, пока не сдохнешь. Но игра не так проста как кажется, ибо приятно удивит вас наличием прокачки скиллов(!), кастомизации персонажа(!!) и крафтинга(!!!). А так сразу и не скажешь, да?)

С убитых зомби падают мани, на которые вы покупаете оружие и открываете закрытые изначально комнаты с более крутым оружием. Параллельно зарабатываете внутриигровую валюту, которую позже будете тратить на шмотки для вашего персонажа (одежда - сплошные пасхалки), прокачку оружия и разблокировку новых уровней.
С зелёных зомби падают ингридиенты для крафта всякого стаффа. Коктейля Молотова, например.

Кто-то сказал, что игра похожа на Killing Floor в 2D. По большому счёту, так и есть. Вот только отдохнуть между волнами вам не дадут. Мочите всех, изворачивайтесь как хотите, копите деньги на пушки покруче пока не помрёте. Умираете - всё заново.

Короче. За что игру можно любить:

- Всяческие отсылки к другим продуктам жанра - Ходячим Мертвецам, Left 4 Dead и т.д. Даже название игры - отсылка.
- Различные виды зомби (Классические "ходуны", бегуны, крепыши, мумии(ага), танки(не те, что вы подумали, но тоже здоровые), зомби-копы со щитами, какие-то личинки и зомби-медведи, которые воруют ваши деньги(опять же, почему бы и нет))
- Кастомизация - это всегда здорово, особенно, когда ты можешь напялить шмотки Ричарда из Hotline Miami или Джейсона Вурхиза. Да и ещё много кого.
- Пушек больше чем дофига.
- Кооператив. Точнее, его наличие. Сам не пробовал пока, но радует сам факт, что он есть.

Итого получаем 10/10ГОСПОДИGOTY360NONSCOPEMLGPROВЕРТУХОЙСРАЗВОРОТАGROOVYПРОДАМГАРАЖспасибозавнимание

21486586.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn is 2D survival shooter!

The game has a rather simplistic thematic, the objective is to survive as long as you can while wave after wave of  zombies attack you. Every wave increases its strenght and resistant so the difficulty to kill them all increases too.

You can earn gold during the game that you can use to upgrade your weapons (there are may kind of them: guns, bombs, shotguns,uzis and a katana) unlock doors or open some fridges.

Zombies drop money too, bullets or some power-ups that are going to help you.

The game has a "level-up" sytem with some perks and some more weapons to unlock.

Behind this simplicity is hidden an addictive way to play, there are some different game modes: single player survival mode, the challenge where you limit your basic weapons and can't buy or upgrade weapons, or the cooperative multiplayer for up-to four players. You can also play with bots if you find some cell phones in the game. 

You don't expect to find the same graphics of L4D2 or the same kind of music and sounds but in general they are correct and nice, animations are smooth and there are a lot of pixels of the screen covered by blood.

In my opinion, four maps are too few, but you have an editor to make your own and share to the rest of the players.

The game has achivements and trading cards. 

Nice game to play if you don't want to think a lot of and you like to kill tons and tons of zombies

You can spend hours and hours playing alone. Unlocking each levels secrets and becoming more powerful. Along the way you will find cellphones that allow you to play with bots that well help you out in more ways that you can imagine. With a max of three bots (that I found) so far you will go from the hunted to the hunter.  

If you are up for it ZKW reborn also has insane multiplayer that will have you just laying waste to zombies. 

As far as the negative reviews, I say ignore em.  The graphics are fine and the AI is great. I actully really like the voice over work.  It feels like having one of your friends brag while playing next to you.  

Get this!

20247725.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week – это быстрый 2D шутер в жанре выживания, в стиле старых и некогда очень увлекательных платформеров. Игра станет твердым орешком, потому что она сложна и очень быстра, почти головокружительна и полна выбросов адреналина. Эта игра отличается от других представителей зомби тематики тем, что в ней не нужно прыгать из уровня в уровень, отвлекаться на сюжет и в конце концов заканчивать игру на кульминационной точке. В ней вы будете лишь пытаться выжить в отчаянных условиях, и чем дольше, тем будет только хуже.

Zombie Kill of the Week – это полноценная кроссплатформенная игра, уже доступная на Andriod и ПК, что позволяет играть в неё четверым друзьям совершенно с разных устройств. А поиграть есть во что. Игра кажется довольно простой с виду, однако обладает огромным разнообразием функций и настроек. За убой всевозможных зомби игроки зарабатывают деньги, которые не принесут счастья, но помогут решить проблему с оружием. Деньги можно потратить на покупку более чем 25 видов оружия, среди которых бензопилы, катаны, мини-пушки, РПГ и многое другое. Деньги также необходимы чтобы открывать двери, активировать прыжки, открывать сундуки-холодильники с ценным лутом. В общем? чем дольше вы живете, тем больше получаете денег и оружия с навыками.

Выжившие также получают ZKW Points – очки за выполнения достижений или удачных серий убийств / выживаний. Эти очки можно обналичить и полностью настроить своего персонажа, персонализировать и проапгрейдить свое оружие, открыть новые карты и получить прочие льготы. ZKW Points – это самая ценная валюта в игре? и получить ее просто играя не получится. По задумке авторов вы должны играть именно хардкорно, вытягивая все жилы из своего игрового персонажа. По мере поднятия своего уровня делать это будет легче. За очки также можно прокачать свои игровые навыки, будь то уровень здоровья и защиты, или разблокировать новые навыки геймплея.

И в компании это делать гораздо интересно. Система прокачки построена так, что бы «скиллы» игроков дополняли друг друга. В Zombie Kill of the Week можно распределить боевые навыки между игроками. Например, специалисты по метательному оружию будут держать опасных зомби на расстоянии, позволяя товарищам истреблять обычных зомби и получать максимум денег. Ко всему прочему совместная игра позволить поднимать свой уровень вверх гораздо быстрее. 

Очень хорошие отзывы игроков, широкий арсенал оружия подходящий под любой стиль ведения боя. Красиво нарисованные карты с удобным редактором для собственного творчества. Полная поддержка контролера и прочие современные возможности, а главное – кровь, очень много крови, которую можно отключить в настройках игры…

19159495.review:
Decent fun, but not a must-have- a typical case of "we need a 'maybe' for recommendations.

I haven't played the mobile version of Zombie Kill of the Week, so I'll review the Steam version in its own merits. It's yet another zombie survival shooter with the simple goal of staying alive as long as possible. Sooner or later you will die- larger and stronger waves of undead constantly charge at you, and it's fun enough to aim for the next highscore.

ZKotW plays as simple as it gets. You control your doomed survivor with the keyboard, aim and shoot with the mouse, and both dropped money and random powerups activate as soon as touched. In short intervals a wave of zombies is released into the level, and killing them all triggers the next wave (which will be larger and tougher). There's little variety in the undead but it's just enough to avoid being too boring. Occasionally a Boss will pay you a visit- these guys are damage sponges and they know it.

Each of the (five) levels confines you to a small starting area at first, armed with nothing but a pistol and a sword. The dropped money can be used to purchase weapons and open doors/activate elevators over time- wave for wave the level opens up and offer potentially better means of surviving yet another wave. Again, it's nothing we haven't seen before, but it works, and claiming more of the level is both useful and fun enough.

In addition to money you'll also be rewarded with tokens that buy you permanent bonuses, special perks, helpful gadgets, or just a nice hat for your character. The system isn't very deep but gives you a reason to play again and get that little damage bonus you may need to make it to the next stage.

And yes, that's it. A fun little time-waster that is just about average in every respect. The music's pretty nice, the graphics do their job, and the controls are good enough (hitboxes, though, are sometimes a bit off). But there is really nothing that makes ZKotW stand out from the crowd. If you're desperate for yet another zombie shooter you'll easily find more complex, rewarding, fun games out there. But sometimes simple just does the trick, and the moderate price tag may appeal to you. You won't get a bad game. Just a rather generic one. 

I still recommend it because it doesn't do anything wrong, there aren't any obvious game-breakers, and it comes with multiplayer and a level editor.

The game is pretty simple. 
You start with a pistol and a katana. X amount of zombies will spawn and you kill them, get money, get a small chance for power ups. Spend money on random weapons in a fridge or to open doors. At lvl 20 you can use it to buy power ups aswell. Bosses will spawn, different enemies, more enemies etc etc. Lots of weapons to unluck with credits which you earn throughout the entire game.

Currently there aren't many maps yet, but Mr Dev adds more and more over time.

18756615.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn
A 2D zombie map shooter that is not your everyday game. 
Try to fight against a massive hoard of zombies from both sides gives the player decide which way to go. 
The map layout is very impressive and yet very simple. Since the map layout will always be the same, it encourages the players to improvise over a compact room, or a large field. There is no comparison to this game to your generic zombie survival games. It has the same aspect of Metal Slug. I recommend getting this game for those for friends who want to duke it out. This is not really a game to main on, but its relaxing to play from time to time. ZKW: Reborn is a game that does not lose its taste from repetition.
Pros:
+Very fun in Co-op (highly recommended with friends)
+Guns, guns, guns
+Funny cheesy one-liner narratation.
+Various perk customization
+Encourages airgame
+Game gets better past round 20
Cons:
- Needs to give melee a bit more love (Only two melee items in the game)
- Needs alot of ZPW coins to grind.
- Limited character customization

This game feels like a game one might find at an arcade - The controls make it feel the same way, like it's meant for joysticks and buttons. Aside from that, it's a very mediocre game. It's enjoyable for about 30 minutes, however i'm sure it would be more enjoyable if I could play with some friends.

Basically, the way you play is that you kill zombies, and you start with a very underpowered pistol. You gain money by killiung zombies, which allows you to buy guns that are sitting around the map or open doors to allow yourself to have more space.

You also can gain xp and level up with this, which unlocks new maps, however they all feel the same.

This game kind of feels like a 2d, sidescrolling call of duty zombies game. However, it lacks much of the features and depth that call of duty zombies offers (this is coming from someone who despises all andany forms of COD, btw).

All in all, I would not recommend this game. It's simply too repetitive to give more than a few  minutes at a time.

18002969.review:
I think this is a great little game and one that we should not "judge by its cover." If you like zombie games and find yourself with only a little bit of time to play, this is a great one to grab. I like that there is no limit to the rounds/waves and no level cap as well as the fact it has a daily challenge for you to do, which is a great encouragement to continue playing. The achievements are not hard to get at all so there is less of a "grind" feel to it if you like to get a perfect game. While it has a single player option (carnage), it also has challenge modes with lead boards and also a multiplayer so you can connect with either your friends or random individuals for a quick game. 

Pros:
-Quick and easy gameplay
-Perks, costumes, and accessories (e.i. turrets, mines, mollys, etc.)
-Easy achievements
-Fitting music (i know, i'm weird)
-Two levels of difficulty to play on
-Optional bots in Carnage mode
-Quick progression
-Nice "art" style
-Able to craft items
-Daily awards/challenges

Cons:
-Only Easy and Normal difficulties (after level 40, you kind of need something a little stronger)
-Some rare glitches (though its not really a problem and sometimes works towards your advantage)

Overall, I would say this game is a 10/10 and is a hell of a lot more fun than you'd think. So why not give it a try? You might be pleasantly suprised.

Pas si mal. Bourrin, moche, mais les niveaux sont un poil trop courts, et les ennemis peu diversifiés.

Les zombis, gros, rapides, les momies, les flics avec un bouclier, les extraterrestres, quelques boss wtf (ours avec une malette Oo), on a vite fait le tour.

Un ecueil. un gros.

Je suis arrivé au niveau +25, personnage pas mal upgradé... qui a tout perdu sans que je sache comment, en reprenant une partie le lendemain. En bref, le système de sauvegarde n'est pas au point. J'ai un personnage niveau 25 qui n'a plus ses boosters (meilleures armes, alliés "bots", etc) qui donnaient envie de progresser dans le jeu, pour survivre plus longtemps dans un niveau.

A l'heure actuelle, à cause de ce défaut énervant... Je ne peux recommander ce titre.

MAJ 14/09/15 : Suite à mes remarques, l'auteur m'a contacté, est à l'écoute et cherche des solutions à mon problème (en vain). 

Donc, je ne recommande pas le jeu à cause d'un défaut rédhibitoire (effacement du personnage malgré le système de sauvegarde en ligne), mais je le recommande à ceux qui veulent un petit jeu d'action fait par un programmeur qui tient compte des avis qu'on lui remonte.

Oui, c'est répétitif, oui, il y a plus beau, oui, le souci que j'ai eu m'énerve, mais le jeu reste un bon défouloir.

CQFD.

17977782.review:
[b]Hours played when writing review : 11[/b]

This game is where you endlessly shoot zombies, bosses, and rat like things that steal your money. You buy new guns, unlock doors & even open fridges.

[h1]Pros :[/h1]

 + Amazing soundtrack to the game
 + Graphics are very nice, animations are smooth.
 + "Level up" system with perks and weapons to unlock and it takes ages to unlock all of them. (I only have about half of it unlocked, 11 hours into the game.)
 + High fps over-all throughout the game.
 + Multiplayer doesn't require you to port-forward, and you can pass-word protect your server.
 
[h1]Cons :[/h1]

 - If you get surrounded by zombies, you're most likely going to die.
 - Not very many maps. (Not sure if they will add more maps in the future.)
 - You might lag in multi-player...a lot. (Rare occasion, but it still happens.)
 - Not very many people play this game during certain hours of the day. Hard to get anyone to join a server.

[h1]Overall :[/h1]

[b]9 / 10 stars.[/b]
I would highly recommend this game to everyone who enjoys killing zombies. It is very fun, even when you are playing by yourself. 
[i]I thought this game would be a waste of time. I was wrong.[/i]

Almost pure looting and leveling in this fine 2D-Zombie-Shooter. But what you can do and level up, marvelous :D
Skills (better shooting, reloading etc.) with skill point. And nearly everything else with money you earn trough achievements. Achievements are worth something in this game. Wow. 
The everything else includes Perks (Better Headshotdamage, Bullet Piercing etc.) Weapon buying, Weapon Custumization, new Hats and more.
Furthermore you can find Items and build one-use items like molotow-cocktails.

All in all, a rewarding little game. And with Multiplayer-Capabilitys (but you can also use bots, if you find the hidden cellphones in the maps, which you also with the ingame money have to buy first. The maps that is)

[h1]Étonnamment bon[/h1]

Zombie Kill of the Week est un peu étrange certes il à une gueule de jeu flash et ce joue comme un jeu flash mais en même temps il s'avère que ce titre est plutôt bon et sacrément amusant. Pour faire court il s'agit plus ou moins d'une version 2D et pixelisées du mode zombie de call of duty mais avec quelque features en plus. Il est par exemple ici possible de crafter des objets, d'améliorer son personnage, de changer son look, d'augmenter les caractéristiques de ces armes et etc... 

Le jeu dispose donc d'un système d'argent et d'xp plutôt bien pensé et qui contribue fortement a la rejouabilité du titre. Le jeu est très amusant en mode Multijoueurs à 4 notamment dans les vagues d'ennemies supérieure ( +30 ) où l'action effrénée et la difficulté de plus en plus grande rende la partie intense mais particulièrement bonne à jouer. 

A ma grande surprise je ressort très content de ce jeu, mais [u]je ne le recommande pas à son prix de base qui est de 5.99€. Le jeu est très sympa mais il ne vaut clairement pas son prix, acheter le de préférence en soldes.[/u]

17925723.review:
Puedo decir que no esperaba mucho de este juego.. pero es feo criticar algo sin haberlo jugado y pues me lo compre.
El juego tiene una tematica bastante simplista.. el objetivo es sobrevivir el mayor tiempo que se pueda oleada tras oleada de zombies, cada vez mas fuertes y resistentes, durante la partida ganaras oro que usaras para mejorar tus armas o comprar otras mejores.
Tiene distintos modos de juegos, entre ellos el multijugador y el desafio que es bastante divertido ya que te limitas a tus armas basicas ya que no puedes comprar ni mejorar armas, no es facil y por eso es divertido.
No crei que el cooperativo sea tan activo, pero aunque no veas una sala activa puedes crear la tuya y en menos de 10 segundos tendras 2 o 3 jugadores pidiendote que comienzes con la partida.
Los graficos de este juego son.. Perfectos, la jugabilidad excelente y aunque su tematica sea bastante simple el juego te traera largas horas de diversion, Vale la pena gastarte un dinerico en este juego.

8/10

17925387.review:
Auf, auf! Erneut in die Zombie-Schlacht! (..hatten wir das nicht schon einmal?)
In diesem 2D Survival Shoot'em'Up schlüpft ihr in die Rolle einer ums Überleben kämpfenden Person, in einem Post-Apokalyptischen Szenario - ein Zombiespiel eben. Dabei könnt ihr mehrere Spielmodi wählen:
Carnage, Challenge und der interessanteste » Multiplayer.  

Grundlegend starten wir in einem Level nur mit Pistole und Katana ausgestattet und versuchen Zombiewellen zu überstehen. Haben wir eine gewisse Anzahl Zombies getötet, kommen wir in die nächste Runde, die uns eine weitere Welle beschert. Auf dem Level verteilt gibt es Tore, die man prinzipiell erst ab einer bestimmten Runde mit dem durchs Metzeln erhaltenem Geld öffnen kann. Dadurch kann man dann einen weiteren Teil des Levels erkunden und unter anderem neue Waffen oder Upgrades für seine Waffen finden. Die Spielfigur kann 3 Waffen tragen, wovon eine immer das Katana ist und die zwei weiteren frei durch die am Boden liegenden oder in Kühlschränken versteckten Waffen kauf- und wählbar sind. In bestimmten Runden werdet ihr auch von etwas stärkeren Bossgegnern überrand - Granaten sind hier sehr hilfreich!

Die Anzahl der derzeit 5 Level können mit einem, derzeit noch deutlich ausbaufähigen, Leveleditor ausgebaut werden. Leider können diese zum Zeitpunkt des Schreibens dieses Reviews (07.09.2015) noch nicht im Multiplayer verwendet werden, dafür aber relativ einfach in den Workshop geladen und heruntergeladen/abonniert werden.

Euer Charakter kann sogar modifiziert werden! Neben dem vergeben von Fähigkeitspunkten, können Waffen verbessert und/oder mit der freigespielten Ingame-Währung freigekauft werden. Zusätzlich kann man auch das äußere das Charakters verändern: Du wolltest schon immer einmal in einem Hausmädchenkostüm durch eine Zombieapokalypse springen und dabei einen Gorillakopf tragen? - Hier hättest du die Chance dazu!

Alles in allem ist das Spiel meiner Meinung nach sein Geld absolut wert. Es macht gerade im Multiplayer unglaublichen Spaß, aber auch der Einzelspieler lädt zum "immer mal wieder einlegen" ein. Man kann modifizieren, eigene Level erstellen und der Entwickler des Spiels ist nicht nur fleißig am updaten und verbessern, sondern scheint sich auch nahezu jedem Eintrag im Community-Hub durchzulesen. In diesem Sinne auch:

Dear Developer,
Because I've seen that you're reading the Community-Hub very actively, 
I just wanna leave some greetings from germany. Really great game, keep it on!

Also, holt es euch. Es macht wirklich Laune! :)

17922928.review:
Very fun game. Like the 2D Side Scrolling version of Call of Duty's Zombie mode. You can play online with people, though I haven't tried it yet. If you want to have someone or something shooting along side you, you can find the Cell Phones Hidden throughout the levels. When you get a Cell Phone, that Permanently increases the number of AI Human Helpers/Survivors with you by 1. So If I have 3 Cell Phones, whenever I start a level, I can choose to bring up to 3 AI's with me. The AI's are dumb as rocks, and have some serious problems path-finding in certain levels, but they're way better than nothing, and actually do help you quite a bit. The first Cell Phone is easy to get, but the ones in other levels are harder.

As for the rest of the game, There are around 5 Official Levels/Maps in the game, with the option of either building your own with the games Level Editor, or downloading more from the Workshop. I don't know how many guns there are. bit O know there's at least 13 different guns, and they're different enough not to seem like just a reskin.

Weapons are spread throughout the level in fixed spots, so the harder it is to get to it, the better, usually. There's also Items you can buy with ZKW-R Tokens, which are dropped by enemies occasionally or awarded to you when getting an achievement or finishing the Daily Challenge. The Items include stuff like meat, which attracts zombies to it, a Dual Wield Pistol, Molotov's, 3 different Turrets, and a bunch more.

There's persistence throughout the game too, when it comes to your character and the weapons. There's a 'Weapon Customization' menu, where you can use your earned ZKW-R Tokens to permanently upgrade the various weapons damage, accuracy, reload speed, and firing rate. Honestly, I don't see much a difference with accuracy, since you're usually close enough for it to not matter.

Along with the weapon upgrades, your character earns experience when he kills a zombie. Once you level up, you get a point to invest into various skills. There's like, 8 different skills, but I found only 2 of them useful. Gun Expert and Money Finder. Gun Expert increase gun damage and reload speed, which is very useful. And Money Finder increases the value of money pickups.

There's also a crafting system, however to craft the good stuff, you have to invest quite a few skill points in the Handy Man Skill, which means less for Gun Expert and Money Finder, and to make things worse the crafting materials rarely drop to begin with. By the time the materials drop to craft even the simplest things have finally dropped, you could have just spent ZKW-R Tokens to buy 4 more, since the ZKW-R Tokens drop far more often than both the craft mats and the pickups.

Oh yeah, there are pickups too that zombies occasionally drop. They're stuff like temporary fire/plasma/piercing bullets, temporary armor, ammo refill, healing, etc. Power ups drop less than the ZKW-R Tokens, but far more than the crafting mats, so they're fairly reliable. And unlike crafting, you can level up your 'Lucky Bastard' skill to increase the drop chance of power ups.

There's an option, also, that tells you when a multiplayer games is available to join, which is nice since while the game isn't dead, there isn't a endless list of join-able games either. More often than not, you wouldn't have to wait more than 10 Minutes to find a game, and whether you're in the menu or in game, a message will pop up alerting you. You can turn this off of course.

Well, there's some other features, but they're small, though still convenient, and you'll find them out soon enough. The gameplay is fun and what you'd expect: kill the zombie waves for money to buy guns. Unlock doors with cash to get further in. Find cell phones, etc.

The music is decent. Fits the game, but I wouldn't call it good, but I wouldn't call it bad either. The voice acting of your character is so laughably bad though, but I found it more amusing than anything else.

So, fun gameplay, plenty of persistence in weapon upgrading and character leveling, good amount of levels and weapons, AI companions, and funny voice acting. The Dev plans on updating the game too. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes Call of Duty's Zombie mode, or zombie arena type games.

17082279.review:
I've played 6 hours on this game at the time of writing this review, I have no doubt this will increase in the future.

Currently without sale this game is £5 or (7/8$ for my USA friends), and at first glance, I'd not have paid near this! For me I picked it up in a sale I think it was £1.50 and thought why not? What a shame that a game so fun with such hidden depth can be off putting from price. The developer would have made much more money had the starting price been around £2! Anyways this is business and I'm not rating the game on it's marketing.

I can't stress this enough, this game has hidden depth, you see a typical platform 2d shooter and think "played it before" and in a sense you have, but this has RPG elements, you collect coins to buy better stats for the guns you can collect in the game, though you can never max out a gun, you can hold 2 guns as well as a sword, so being intelligent about your choices dpending wheree you are in a level (each level plays differently) really matters. You can collect parts to put together to make automatic turrets, or mines, or fire bombs etc. You can update the starting gun to dual pistols or a desert eagle and much more.

I really recommend this game highly, as a game developer myself(indie) I'd be very proud to say I had developed this game, it's games like this where you look past graphics and see sheer gameplay.

Experience 7/10
fun 9/10

Buy now!

16566488.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn is a 2D zombie action game where you have to defend yourself against the horde. In ZKWR you have to fight off wave after wave of undead in hostile environments. Killing zombies will earn you money which can then be spent on weapons and unlocking doors. Killing undead also rewards you with EXP and when you get enough to level up you earn tokens which can be spent on customising/upgrading your character.

+Decent pixel graphics, they aren't the best but I've certainly seen worse
+Tons of customisation options for your character such as perks, weapon upgrades and clothing
+Quite a lot of different weapons with a few more to be unlocked
+Good variety of zombies to kill
+EXP is permanent as are upgrades and appearance customisations
+A few different pickups/powerups which help you, they're basically rip-offs of the ones you'll find in CoD so they're pretty self-explanatory
+If you have no friends to play with you can play with bots but 
+The 5 currently available maps are very different to one another
+Nice soundtrack

-As soon as zombies start attacking you from both sides you're pretty much screwed, especially if the fast moving zombies are in play
-Zombies still function and are able to kill you for a few seconds after you destroy their head which is pretty irritating
-Playing this game Singleplayer gets boring very quickly
-Bots have to be unlocked by finding items on the maps which I found annoying
-Painfully bad voice acting

Verdict:
Solo only: Worth purchasing on sale (6.5/10)

Multiplayer as well as Solo: Worth purchasing (7.5/10)

A decent Zombie horde style game with decent graphics, tons of customisation, a fair few types of undead and good maps that's let down by it's lack of focus on singleplayer.

[*]Character customization

Negatives:
[list][*]4:3 Aspect Ratio
[*]Very little depth to the overall gameplay (It's zombie wave-mode type game, not much to make depth with)
[*]Multiplayer requires you to sign up on a website (The game is on Steam, this shouldn't be required of a Steam user)

My only issue with this game is that is doesn't feel like it belongs within the PC game marketplace. It's just not the right type of game. It would be an excellent mobile game but for an content/immersion craving PC audience, this game doesn't deliver.

15418256.review:
[h1] Game Detail [/h1]
Name: Zombie Kill of The Week - REBORN
Developer: Still Running 
Genre: Survival, Horde Mode, Resouce Management, Lite- RPG
Multiplayer: Yes. Not tested. Lack friends with copies.
Bots: Yes. Lobotomized but can carry a gun.

[h1] What is Zombie Kill of The Week? [/h1]
[b] Short Version [/b]
A resource managing zombie survival game with lite-rpg element. Now you can safely skip the longer version if you want straight into the graphic section. I wouldn't think less of you.

[b] Long Version [/b]
Game development for this game was rather 'convulated' so as to speak. I tried the version that was a standalone EXE all those years ago so imagine my surprise when i saw this game on steam. Both of horror and joy. A memory tainted by nostalgia and stained by terrible remembering ability. Anyways.....

It's basically a 2D pixel art zombie horde survival game set in a single location of your choosing 24/7. What 24/7 implies is that there is no cooldown at all between waves. You killed all the zombie? Well have fun because here is another wave, and another and another and another till you drop on your knees praying to a god which i do not know then die. Rinse and repeat! Also apparently you have all the cliche zombie weapons such as shotguns, katana and even the fabled chainsaw. 

On with the review.

[b] Gameplay [/b] 
You start the round with a pistol and a katana that is supremely weak in all aspect other than the fact that the pistol can do headshots but that is pretty much it. Through slaying/shooting zombies you gain money to unlock door ala call of duty zombies style and to buy weapons. Also dropped by the zombies are powerups such as a medkit that heals you, bullet restoration and even a hit everything that will save your life a lot of time.

Guns come in all shapes and sizes but the best weapons are locked behind the refrigerator system which i will explain later and also you have to unlock some of the weapon via premium currency which i will also explain later. Most of the guns are the typical fare such as shotgun, machinegun and smg. Interestingly enough once you unlock enough room you gain access to the upgrade mission which for a steep price will make your guns better.

Zombies also fit most of the trope we find in films and other setting but you see i am unable to confirm zombies above wave 28 since i died at that point. You have the runner, the shambler, the fat guy and a few different bosses. Now it goes without saying that since this is a 2D game you don't have as much wriggle room as oppose to 3D game therefor brushing up against zombies is enough to incur damage on your side. BTW health are not represented by health bar but instead the more closer you are to death the bloodier you get but don't worry since your mate/bots can very easily revive you provided you did not die at a location where they swarm like mad.

Every level has a refrigerator where you can pay money to get a random weapon. Buy too often and it will disappear into another part of the map. The refrigerator is also the only place where you can get the very powerful guns in the game minus the rather useless minigun.

There are 1 mobile phone scattered in each level which allows you to call a bot in to help you with the rampage, They are dumb are brick but thankfully they can carry a gun which proves useful enough for them. Otherwised they are just dumb bricks.

You gain exp as you play and gain levels that you can spend on skillpoints that aids in a lot of aspect of your character such as money collecting, gun reload speed and oh well you know the rest don't you? The only one not in the list is increased resilient against damage. There are also Z-Token that are dropped randomly as you play. Used to upgrade your weapons, buy accessories, and unlock new maps you will soon find these to be in short supply forcing you to run through a map multiple time to grind through them.

Accessories are a unique thing. They have a set limit amount you can carry [at 10] and they have limited uses plus the fact that they are bought with Z-Token makes them a grind tool to help with the tougher wave and not to be squandered at the earlier waves. The inventory is mapped to the I button just in case you didn't know how to use them. 

Z-Token are also used to purchase useful perks that helps your character in the game although the cheap 25 token Rampage perk is more than enough for any needs.

You can also customize your character look and err... apparently there is a certain maid in the game. Spoilers. You use Z-Token to buy those looks. Naturally.

[b] Graphics [/b]
2D pixel arts. At times the art look rather ugly but i suppose fighting off 20 undead at the same time makes you rather forgiving of this shortcoming. But hey, at least you will be able to tell the important thing such as guns, powerups and items at a glance. It's ugly in a functional way.

[b] Sounds [/b] 
Sounds blend in good enough without getting in the way. Guns are boomy and everything works as expected although the in game character i suggest you mute him since his voice is rather jarring to the overall game. Seriously.

[b] Conclusion [/b]
All these years the game hasn't change much but i argue that the core component that makes it fun is still there intact and not lost in the years. Therefor go look for 3 mates and buy all 3 of them a copy and go play this 2D survival game like no tomorrow. Because tomorrow is a farce anyways since it is merely the rotation of the earth that cause the shifting of light and darkness.

Scoring Methology [Courtesy of Meat King]:
-	S-Rank: excellent
-	A-Rank: very good
-	B-Rank: solid
-	C-Rank: satisfactory
-	D-Rank: inferior

Verdict: B-Rank

14959895.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn is a challenging, fast paced, 2D survival shooter!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zkGuPioVhNY
And when we say fast, we mean breakneck, flat-out, adrenaline fuelled fast! What’s different from the other shooters is your goal isn’t to run through levels and finish the game, but to survive for as long as possible under increasingly frantic conditions (we say as long as possible because ultimately you will die!).

Seems simple enough, but where Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn really takes off is in the added layers of depth and huge variety of features and customisation available. Players earn money for slaughtering the zombies (money might not bring you happiness, but it does buy you guns!). We live in a consumer society after all, which is useful, as you can spend big on over 25 different weapons (including chainsaw, katana, mini-gun, RPG, D.O.M. and many others!). You also need cash to open doors, activate jumps, buy new weapons, or hunt for the magic fridge and see what loot drops are inside! In short… the longer you survive, the more weapons and prizes you get. 

Surviving longer also gains you ZKW-Points which you can cash in to totally customize your character, customize your weapons, buy new weapons, buy different perks, open new maps, and a lot lot more! Players also earn XP as they play, allowing them to level-up their character and develop them to fit their chosen gameplay skills. Survival is all about the margins, and every little extra helps! 

The Steam release also features an exclusive level editor for the Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn community, which allows the community to create their own custom and bespoke maps, then share them with friends (and enemies) for everyone to enjoy. Endless permutations and maps means endless challenges. 

With a compelling single player survival mode, as well as cooperative multiplayer for up-to four players, this is one zombie firefight you are not going to want to miss! If that wasn't enough you can even play cross-platform play with Android owners too!  - Highly Recommended!

14870195.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn ist ein 2D Sidescrolling Plattformer. Es geht darum möglichst lange zu leben und nicht zu überleben. Der Tod ist also Vorprogrammiert. Um dich möglichst lange am leben zu halten helfen dir Medipacks, Shields, Munition und ein breites Arsenal an Waffen. Welle für Welle. Die Zombiehorden werden immer Stärker und ehe du dich versiehst...bist du selbst einer..doch bis dahin gilt es möglichst viele mitzunehmen in den Tod (also danach :-).

ZKoTW-Reborn ist eine Handyadaption. Die Steuerung wurde excellent auf den PC angepasst und ist sogar mit dem Gamepad zu bedienen. Am meisten Spaß macht es natürlich wenn man 3 Freunde mit in die Zombie-Apokalypse nimmt. Untermalt wird das ganze von passenden Hard Rock Sound, welcher gut zum Spiel passt. Gelegentliche Kommentare von der Spielfigur, wirken mir ein wenig zu aufgesetzt und fallen auch leicht im Geballer unten durch. 

Die Grafik ist Pixelig und der Splattergrad recht hoch. Das kann man jedoch im Spielmenü an oder eben aus schalten. Die Karten ändern sich wenn man sie neu startet. Ich hatte zb. in einem Durchlauf alles verschlossene Türen wo man nur mit Geld weiter kam. Im nächsten Durchlauf brauchte ich den richtigen Schlüssel.

*Nachtrag*

Über das Menü "Player" Kann man sich perks aussuchen Skillpunkte verteilen  oder aber ZKW ( Zombie Kill of the Week Marken) ausgeben. Das Menü ist etwas Versteckt. wer es also sucht findet es unter diesem Menüpunkt.


Weiterhin bietet dieses Spiel:

Ein breites Arsenal an Waffen, inklusive: Kettensäge, RPG, Katana, Minigun, MP5 uvw.

Über 20 Steam Achievments

4 Karten ( Die sich immer leicht ändern )

Exklusiver Level Editor für den PC zum Erstellen hochladen und gemeinsames Zocken mit Freunden (oder der Steam Comunity)

Cooperativer Multiplayer für bis zu 4 Spieler

Gamepad Unterstützung

Online Highscore

Waffen und Spieler Customization

Skills, Trophäen, Perks, Blut und Gewalt ( gegen Zombies )

Original Soundtrack von Roland La Goy

Spielbar auf dem Handy

Kurzum für 5,99 macht man hier nichts Falsch. Kaufempfehlung 


Kleiner Einblick gefällig?

14869397.review:
I'm now writing my thoughts as a player.

The game in its core is fun, but it really suffers from a bunch of different things:
- Game is by default on 4:3 and a VERY low resolution, str8 ported from mobile without any PC optimization. PC games need a higher resolution. The menu's make me dizzy as it looks like a mess because its scaled up from 480x320 to 1920x1080. This needs to be addressed and the menus really need to be re-designed for PC platform.
- Some HUD elements are overlapping like red texts in the crafting page making everything very confusing.
- Multiplayer doesn't seem to be that stable, I'm not sure how its done but people keep disconnecting and there is no real way to have a long enough play session.
- Chat is in mobile design (press button to open string and then enter message) not a good idea. PC version could have a chat box which would fit if the menu's would be re-designed for bigger screens.
- In overal feels like a mobile game played on a PC screen.

For these reasons I wouldn't recommend this on the desktop platform, but for mobile. If these changes are addressed then I'd be happy to recommend it.

14868664.review:
Zombie Kill of the Week, the game that was originally created back in 2010, and now, it's Reborn.

In this game, you play as your whoever you feel like you want to be. You are forced to survive wave after wave against a horde of zombies that will try to get you at whatever cost at all.  After a certain amount of waves a Mini-boss will spawn and your goal is to kill it, and once you do something magical happens. You can buy perks, upgrade weapons and upgrade skills using ZKW-coins that you earn by playing the game from within the ingame Store- you can also customise your player and use the ingame map editor to make your own maps and share them on StillRunnings own servers (You will need to make a StillRunning account to do so). And multiplayer works great, from what i have seen. I didn't experience any lag at all and people where able to join my lobby without any problems. 

There are many maps to chose from, and in most maps you will be able to find a cellphone that will let you add bots to your game later on. Also, like in the Call of Duty Zombies mode, there are drops that give you special powers such as insta-kill or rapid fire.

Overall, this game is amazing for the price. 5.99€ for a game that will bring you hours of fun! :)
